title: Salhouse Broad Walk Route

images.title: Salhouse Broad by Steve Daniels, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Salhouse Broad

images.title: Evelyn Simak / This way to Salhouse Broad
images.caption: This way to Salhouse Broad Salhouse Broad, owned by H. Cator of Woodbastwick estate, lies on the river Bure; it is 32 acres in size and consists of a mixture of habitats including open water, sedge beds, alder carr, grassland, heathland and ancient woodland. A 21 year lease to the Broads Authority ended in July 2003 and the management of the area returned to the responsibility of Mr Cator.

images.title: The River Bure by Salhouse Broad by Steve Daniels, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The River Bure by Salhouse Broad

images.title: Evelyn Simak / Red-brick cottages
images.caption: Red-brick cottages in Salhouse village. On Farm Hall Drive. Much of the village of Salhouse is now covered by a Conservation Order and it is hoped that its rural character will be maintained.

images.title: Nick Smith / View along footpath from Salhouse Broad to car park
images.caption: View along footpath from Salhouse Broad to car park

images.title: Evelyn Simak / Tree-lined river bank
images.caption: Tree-lined river bank. Mature trees growing on the eastern bank of the River Bure, with a glimpse at fields belonging to Woodbastwick estate beyond.

description: This walk visits Salhouse Broad in the Norfolk Broads National Park. The pretty little broad is located between Salhouse and Woodbastwick near to the larger settlements of Wroxham and Horning. The walk can be started from the public car park just to the north east of Salhouse village, off the Salhouse Road. From here you can follow public footpaths north to visit the broad. There's nice trails along the broad with views of the River Bure, which runs through the area. The area is good for wildlife spotting with several species of dragonfly and various water loving birds.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Hungry Otter is located right next to the broad. You can pick up hot drinks and delicious cakes here.

display_address: Slad Lane, Woodbastwick, Broadland, Norfolk, England, NR13 6HQ, United Kingdom
